title: Drawing, "Gate with Papal Arms"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, black chalk indications on paper
markings:
Cooper Union Museum stamp on the verso
No watermark visible
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Elevation of a gate inserted into a wall.  The gate's walls are rusticated.  It includes two massive rounded Ghibelline battlements.  The doorway has a classical frame.  Above, the arcaded dome rises behind the wall with openings of defensive purposes.  The papal arms are shown over a blank escutcheon, with cornucopias on either side.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Gate with Papal Arms".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, black chalk indications on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-6672.
